population_specificity: Mice with OA induced by partial medial meniscectomy (PMM).
effective_dosage: Administered by oral gavage twice per week (exact dosage not specified).
study_duration: Duration not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Lactobacillus acidophilus affects the metabolism of Olsalazine in ulcerative colitis treatment by examining pharmacokinetics, gut microbiota, and metabolic enzymes.
results_summary: The study found that L. acidophilus did not alter the pharmacokinetics of Olsalazine or increase colonic exposure to 5-ASA but improved UC treatment by modulating gut microbiota composition and metabolic pathways.
population_specificity: Patients with ulcerative colitis (specific details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of diode laser (980 nm) at different times and doses on reducing the growth of Lactobacillus acidophilus.
results_summary: The study found that diode laser irradiation significantly reduced L. acidophilus growth, with the most effective dose being 10 J/cm² for 5 seconds both immediately and 24 hours after exposure.
population_specificity: In vitro bacterial cultures (L. acidophilus at 10⁸ CFU/ml).
effective_dosage: 5, 10, and 20 J/cm² with irradiation times of 5, 10, and 20 seconds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to sequence the genome of Lactobacillus acidophilus LA-10A to understand its molecular features and its role in treating and preventing Helicobacter pylori infection.
results_summary: The study sequenced the genome of Lactobacillus acidophilus LA-10A, providing molecular insights into its characteristics. The strain is noted for its effectiveness in treating and preventing Helicobacter pylori infection.
population_specificity: Not specified (strain isolated from fermented mare's milk).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism of action of a combined treatment of Lactobacillus acidophilus and Chinese medicine HKL in alleviating ulcerative colitis by modulating gut microbiota, metabolites, and inflammatory pathways.
results_summary: The combined treatment upregulated anti-inflammatory cytokines (IL-13, TGF-β), downregulated pro-inflammatory markers (TLR9, TLR4), increased beneficial bacteria (Bifidobacterium), reduced opportunistic pathogens (Klebsiella, Escherichia-Shigella), and improved metabolic profiles, including SCFA production.
population_specificity: UC rat model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus NCFM in treating cyclophosphamide-induced hemorrhagic cystitis in Wistar rats.
results_summary: Lactobacillus acidophilus NCFM demonstrated a uroprotective effect, preventing bladder inflammation and hemorrhage in both short-term (24-hour) and long-term (30-day) treatments, with results comparable to the standard treatment (mesna).
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats with cyclophosphamide-induced hemorrhagic cystitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Lactobacillus acidophilus and other lactobacilli could reduce virulence traits of C. parapsilosis and improve epithelial resistance to fungal infection.
results_summary: The study found that Lactobacillus acidophilus cell-free supernatants reduced C. parapsilosis proliferation, viability, and metabolic activity, while also enhancing epithelial resistance to the fungus, suggesting a potential role in preventing mucosal infection.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of Lactobacillus acidophilus in managing acute gastroenteritis in children, focusing on its impact on diarrhea duration and frequency.
results_summary: Lactobacillus acidophilus reduced diarrhea duration (moderate-quality evidence) and frequency (significant on day 3), particularly at doses ≥ 10^9 CFU, though the effect was not statistically significant for individual strains alone. No regional differences in efficacy were observed.
population_specificity: Children with acute gastroenteritis

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the anticancer effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus KLDS1.0901 on colon cancer cells, specifically its ability to inhibit proliferation and induce apoptosis.
results_summary: L. acidophilus KLDS1.0901 inhibited the proliferation of HT-29 and Caco-2 cells in a dose-dependent manner, increased apoptosis rates and reactive oxygen species in HT-29 cells, and affected mitochondrial membrane potential and gene expression related to apoptosis pathways.
population_specificity: Colon cancer cell lines (HT-29, Caco-2) and normal intestinal epithelial cells (IEC-6).
effective_dosage: Multiplicity of infection (MOI) = 100 (rate of Lactobacillus to cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dietary supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus and Bacillus subtilis on intestinal immune response, barrier function, microbiota, and metabolites in late-phase laying hens.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation improved intestinal barrier integrity, reduced inflammatory cytokines, increased immunoglobulin levels, enhanced gut microbiota diversity, and positively altered amino acid and lipid metabolism.
population_specificity: Late-phase laying hens
effective_dosage: 250 mg/kg (LD group) and 500 mg/kg (HD group) of a B. subtilis and L. acidophilus mixture powder

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-protozoal effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus LB against Cryptosporidium parvum in comparison to nitazoxanide and other treatments.
results_summary: Lactobacillus acidophilus LB showed a high oocysts reduction rate (95.77%), comparable to zinc and dill seed oil, and outperformed clove oil and was slightly better than nitazoxanide (91.55%). Immunohistochemical analysis confirmed the clearance of Cryptosporidium antigen in the intestinal tissue.
population_specificity: Mice infected with Cryptosporidium parvum oocysts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize lactic acid production by Lactobacillus acidophilus PTCC 1643 in a date syrup-based medium using response surface methodology (RSM) and genetic algorithm (GA) analysis.
results_summary: The study found that increasing sucrose and yeast extract concentrations enhanced cell growth and lactic acid production, while ultrasound at 25% amplitude significantly stimulated fermentation. However, higher ultrasound amplitude (50%) reduced lactic acid production compared to controls.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the combination of Lactobacillus acidophilus and FK506 could effectively and safely mitigate graft-versus-host disease (GvHD) following allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.
results_summary: The combination treatment suppressed pro-inflammatory T cell differentiation (IFN-γ and IL-17-producing cells) while enhancing regulatory T cell (Foxp3+Treg) differentiation and IL-10 production. It also alleviated GvHD clinically and histopathologically by modulating the balance between effector T cells and Tregs.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation and liver transplantation patients (peripheral blood mononuclear cells from healthy controls and LT patients were also studied).
interactions: Interaction with FK506 (immunosuppressant) was noted, enhancing therapeutic effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus and/or Mannan oligosaccharides on growth performance, blood biochemical variables, and gut microbiota in crossbred calves.
results_summary: Lactobacillus acidophilus improved body weight gain, dry matter digestibility, and blood serum protein levels, while reducing fecal coliform and E. coli counts. The combination with Mannan oligosaccharides (synbiotic) showed similar benefits.
population_specificity: Fifteen-day-old crossbred calves (n=24).
effective_dosage: 2 × 10^10 cfu/g @ 1 g/calf per day (probiotic), 0.5 g + Mannan oligosaccharide 2 g/calf per day (synbiotic).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-obesity effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus isolated from the porcine gut and its potential to improve metabolic health.
results_summary: L. acidophilus reduced body weight, fat mass, inflammation, and insulin resistance in mice on a high-fat diet, improved gut microbiota composition, and enhanced metabolic functions. The anti-obesity effects were transmissible via fecal transfer.
population_specificity: Mice fed a high-fat diet (HFD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether Lactobacillus acidophilus and Lactobacillus rhamnosus could reduce H. pylori bacterial load and modify gut microbiota.
results_summary: The probiotic group showed a significant reduction in H. pylori bacterial load compared to placebo, but no eradication of H. pylori or significant changes in gut microbiota composition were observed.
population_specificity: 40 adult subjects with moderate to high H. pylori bacterial loads.
effective_dosage: Probiotics containing Lactobacillus acidophilus and Lactobacillus rhamnosus, twice daily (specific strain counts not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of nonviable Lactobacillus acidophilus (NVL) and a mixed prebiotic blend on fecal microbiota, fermentative end products, and gut immune health in dogs.
results_summary: The study found that the mixed prebiotic (MP) blend, with or without NVL, significantly altered fecal microbiota, reduced fecal pH, increased fecal IgA, and improved fermentative end products. NVL alone showed fewer effects, but the combination with MP enhanced some benefits, such as reducing harmful fecal compounds.
population_specificity: Healthy adult Beagle dogs (n = 24; 5.74 ± 2.18 years; 9.30 ± 1.32 kg).
effective_dosage: Not specified (fed once daily to maintain body weight).
study_duration: 21 days per treatment period (total of four treatment and four washout periods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Lactobacillus acidophilus (LA) with tacrolimus (Tac) improves therapeutic efficacy by modulating T cell subsets in a murine model of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
results_summary: The combination therapy of LA and Tac restored gut dysbiosis, reduced double-negative T cells, lowered serum autoantibodies, alleviated renal pathology, and improved Th17/Treg balance in SLE mice. LA also induced immune-modulating molecules like IDO, PD-L1, and IL-10 in vitro.
population_specificity: MRL/lpr mice (a murine model of SLE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Lactobacillus acidophilus could stimulate and modulate the respiratory immune system in response to SARS-CoV-2-related immune challenges.
results_summary: The study found that Lactobacillus acidophilus treatment resulted in higher lymphocyte counts and significant differences in lymphocyte infiltration in lung tissue compared to controls, suggesting immune modulation.
population_specificity: Male DDY strain mice (Mus musculus) aged 1-2 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the supportive therapy potential of acidophilus milk (containing Lactobacillus acidophilus LA-5) and propolis extract in a mouse xenograft breast cancer model.
results_summary: The combination of acidophilus milk and propolis extract significantly inhibited tumor volumes by 63.39%, enhanced splenocyte proliferation, and stimulated IFN-γ production. The study concluded that the combination showed the best anti-tumor effect.
population_specificity: Balb/c mice injected with 4T1 mouse breast cancer cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Lactobacillus acidophilus with Clostridium cochlearium (CC-LA) could reduce obesity and improve glucose metabolism in high-fat diet-induced obese mice.
results_summary: The CC-LA group showed 17% less body weight gain, improved glucose tolerance, reduced insulin resistance, and favorable changes in gut microbiota diversity compared to the high-fat diet control group. The Firmicutes to Bacteroidetes ratio decreased significantly, and obesity-related microbial taxa were reduced.
population_specificity: 6-week-old male C57BL/6 mice fed a high-fat diet.
effective_dosage: Not specified (CC-LA mixture administered, exact dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic supplementation (Lactobacillus acidophilus) enhanced the effects of caloric restriction on body composition, quality of life, sleep quality, and mental health symptoms in obese adult men.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation did not improve body composition, quality of life, or sleep parameters compared to caloric restriction alone. However, it was associated with reduced anxiety and depressive symptoms in the probiotic group, though no significant differences were found between groups after 12 weeks.
population_specificity: Adult men aged 25-44 with obesity (BMI 30.0-39.99 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of a commercially available multi-ingredient powder (AG1) containing Lactobacillus acidophilus on human health.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Lactobacillus acidophilus's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotics, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, reduce in-hospital mortality and improve cardiovascular outcomes in patients with acute myocardial infarction.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study appears to be ongoing or not yet concluded.
population_specificity: Adult patients diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction (n=2594).
effective_dosage: 840 mg (Bifidobacterium longum, Lactobacillus acidophilus, and Enterococcus faecalis) twice daily.
study_duration: Up to 30 days during hospital stay.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, could improve gut microbiota composition in cesarean-delivered infants.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation increased beneficial bacteria abundance and reduced colonization of potentially pathogenic Klebsiella in cesarean-delivered infants. The intervention enriched gut microbiota composition and altered early colonization patterns.
population_specificity: Full-term neonates delivered by cesarean section.
effective_dosage: Not specified (probiotic contained Bifidobacterium longum, Lactobacillus acidophilus, and Enterococcus faecalis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether probiotics, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, could alleviate gastrointestinal symptoms (GIS) and influence Small Intestine Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO) in patients one year after Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB).
results_summary: The study found no significant effects of probiotic supplementation on gastrointestinal symptoms or SIBO prevalence in post-RYGB patients. The chosen probiotic blend, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, did not alleviate symptoms or improve SIBO.
population_specificity: Symptomatic patients one year after Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB).
effective_dosage: 50 billion CFU (combined with other probiotic strains) daily for 8 weeks.
study_duration: 8 weeks per intervention period, with an 8-week washout between periods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotic supplementation on hepatic fibrosis, inflammatory and metabolic markers, and gut microbiota in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
results_summary: The study found that probiotic supplementation improved the AST to Platelet Ratio Index (APRI) score but did not significantly affect liver fibrosis, steatosis, inflammatory activity, or gut microbiota composition. The results suggest probiotics alone may not be sufficient to improve enzymatic liver markers or inflammatory parameters in NASH patients.
population_specificity: 48 patients with NASH, median age 58 y, median BMI 32.7 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 24-week probiotic mix containing Lactobacillus acidophilus could reduce cardiovascular risk markers in patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
results_summary: The study found no significant difference between the probiotic and placebo groups in reducing cardiovascular risk markers, including atherogenic indexes, PAI-1, and miR-122 levels. Probiotic supplementation did not outperform placebo in improving clinical or laboratory parameters.
population_specificity: Adult patients with biopsy-proven non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), predominantly female and white.
effective_dosage: 10^10 CFU daily (probiotic mix, exact Lactobacillus acidophilus dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of probiotic (Lactobacillus acidophilus) and fluconazole on the treatment and recurrence of vulvovaginal candidiasis (VVC).
results_summary: The study compared probiotic capsules with fluconazole for treating VVC, but the abstract does not specify the exact outcomes for Lactobacillus acidophilus.
population_specificity: 80 married women aged 18-49 years with confirmed VVC.
effective_dosage: 30 probiotic capsules containing 1 × 10^[CFU/dose not fully specified].

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a supplement containing tyndallized Lactobacillus acidophilus (HA122) could improve inflammatory markers (IL-6, CRP) and modulate lymphocyte growth in elderly patients.
results_summary: The study found that the supplement improved IL-6, CRP, and lymphocyte levels in elderly patients after 30 days of use, though they did not reach the same levels as young patients. Over 70% of patients reported feeling better after supplementation.
population_specificity: Elderly patients over 60 years old, compared to a young control group.
effective_dosage: Not specified (result was independent of dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, could improve athletic performance in resistance and aerobic exercises.
results_summary: Two studies using Lactobacillus acidophilus observed positive results on performance, but most studies (11 out of 17) showed no effect of probiotics on aerobic performance or muscular strength. The overall evidence was insufficient to support performance improvement.
population_specificity: Athletes, recreationally trained individuals, and untrained healthy individuals aged 18 to 40 years (73% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a multi-strain probiotic, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, combined with dietary and lifestyle modifications, on menstrual regularity, metabolic and hormonal profiles in women with PCOS.
results_summary: The probiotic supplement significantly improved menstrual cycle regularity, total testosterone levels, waist circumference, waist-to-hip ratio, and quality of life in women with PCOS compared to placebo. No adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-40 years with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
effective_dosage: Lactobacillus acidophilus UBLA-34 (2 billion CFU per strain, along with other probiotic strains and fructo-oligosaccharides (100 mg)).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of synbiotics (including Lactobacillus acidophilus) on indoxyl sulphate levels, constipation symptoms, and constipation-related quality of life in haemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant reduction in indoxyl sulphate levels but observed improvements in constipation symptoms and constipation-related quality of life after synbiotic administration.
population_specificity: Chronic haemodialysis patients with gastrointestinal complaints, difficulty defecating, hard stool consistency, or fewer than three bowel movements per week.
effective_dosage: Lactobacillus acidophilus and Bifidobacterium longum at 5x10^9 CFU (exact frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of probiotic supplementation, particularly Lactobacillus acidophilus, in improving liver function, lipid parameters, and anthropometric characteristics in pediatric patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus combined with other strains, significantly improved transaminase levels, lipid profiles, ultrasonographic steatosis, and anthropometric measures in children with NAFLD. The effects were statistically significant and clinically relevant.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of a probiotic supplement containing Lactobacillus acidophilus on the incidence and duration of upper respiratory tract infection symptoms in healthy children.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of Lactobacillus acidophilus.
population_specificity: Healthy school children aged 3-10 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Lactobacillus acidophilus supplementation could improve neurologic function in mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI) by alleviating gut microbiome dysbiosis.
results_summary: In animal models, Lactobacillus acidophilus supplementation improved neurologic function following TBI, but no human studies confirmed neurologic benefits, though it reduced infection rates in severe TBI patients.
population_specificity: Animal models (TBI) and human patients (severe TBI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC) in very-low-birth-weight newborns after supplementation with the probiotic Inforan.
results_summary: The study found that probiotic supplementation reduced the incidence of NEC, though it did not compare the efficacy of different probiotic strains.
population_specificity: Very-low-birth-weight (VLBW) newborns (n=245).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of probiotic supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus on cognitive functioning, focusing on its potential role in influencing inflammation and immune response.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that probiotics, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, may have beneficial effects on cognitive functioning, potentially mediated by their impact on inflammation and immune response, though human data remain limited.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Lactobacillus acidophilus, when used with or after antibiotics, could help restore gut microbiota in neonates with infections.
results_summary: Probiotics (including Lactobacillus acidophilus) used concurrently with antibiotics showed some benefit in promoting Bifidobacterium abundance but did not restore overall gut microbiota diversity. Early probiotic use appeared more beneficial than delayed use.
population_specificity: Full-term neonates diagnosed with neonatal infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a probiotic combination including Lactobacillus acidophilus could reduce upper respiratory infection frequency and severity in children by modulating inflammatory immune responses.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that probiotic supplementation may decrease upper respiratory infection frequency and severity in children, potentially through immune modulation, but specific results for Lactobacillus acidophilus are not detailed.
population_specificity: Children

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a probiotic mixture containing Lactobacillus acidophilus on inflammatory biomarkers, oxidative/nitrosative stress, and disease activity in people with rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The probiotic group showed significant reductions in white blood cell count, tumor necrosis factor-α, and interleukin-6 levels, as well as improvements in oxidative/nitrosative stress biomarkers, though no changes were observed in other inflammatory markers or disease activity scores.
population_specificity: 42 participants with rheumatoid arthritis
effective_dosage: 10^9 CFU/g daily (as part of a multi-strain probiotic mixture)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus during pregnancy reduces the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) and improves maternal and neonatal outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that probiotic supplementation from the second trimester up to 24 weeks of pregnancy did not reduce the risk of GDM or improve other maternal and neonatal outcomes.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in the Middle East, with a mean age of 32.03 years and BMI of 30.20 kg/m².
effective_dosage: 500 mg probiotic capsule (containing Lactobacillus acidophilus LA1 >7.5 × 10^7 CFU) daily.
study_duration: From 14 weeks of pregnancy up to 24 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the influence of probiotic supplementation (Lactobacillus acidophilus) on monocyte functionality in marathon runners before and after the race.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Lactobacillus acidophilus's effects, only mentioning the study's intent to evaluate its impact on immune response in runners.
population_specificity: Marathon runners undergoing intense training and prolonged exercise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 30 days of probiotic supplementation could stabilize the immune system of marathon runners and prevent immune suppression post-race.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Lactobacillus acidophilus, as the study used Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis.
population_specificity: 27 male marathon runners

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, could moderate the immune system's response to sleep disruption caused by night shift work.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation moderated changes in serum markers (cortisol, pentraxin, MAdCAM-1, IL-1ra) associated with anticipatory stress before night shifts, though no significant interaction effects were observed post-shift. The placebo group showed significant changes in these markers during the normal sleep period.
population_specificity: Night shift workers (mean age 41 ± 11 yrs; 74% female).
effective_dosage: 1 × 10^10 CFU/day (specific strain details not fully provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus LA02, aids weight loss in healthy young adult females and to test manufacturers' claims.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in anthropometric measures (body mass, BMI, body fat percentage, etc.) in either the probiotic or placebo groups, suggesting Lactobacillus acidophilus LA02 did not aid weight loss under the tested conditions.
population_specificity: Healthy young adult females aged 19-33.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prophylactic probiotic use of Lactobacillus acidophilus in infants within the German Neonatal Network.
results_summary: The abstract is incomplete, but it mentions that 76.5% of infants received the probiotic, though no specific outcomes or effects are detailed.
population_specificity: Infants in the German Neonatal Network.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of probiotic therapy, including Lactobacillus acidophilus NCFM, on cardiometabolic variables and autonomic function in women with arterial hypertension.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation significantly reduced fasting glucose and cholesterol levels, increased HDL-cholesterol, and improved autonomic modulation, though blood pressure reductions were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Women aged 20-50 years medically diagnosed with arterial hypertension.
effective_dosage: 10^9 CFU daily (combined with other probiotic strains).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of Lactobacillus acidophilus and Bifidobacterium lactis supplementation on gastrointestinal symptoms and small intestine bacterial overgrowth (SIBO) in patients after Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB).
results_summary: The probiotic supplementation reduced bloating but did not influence SIBO development. It also led to mixed effects, including more abdominal pain at T1 (which later reduced), more soft stools and nausea, and less hunger pain, with no urgent episodes to evacuate despite higher fat consumption.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB).
effective_dosage: 5 billion CFU/strain (Lactobacillus acidophilus and Bifidobacterium lactis) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a synbiotic containing Lactobacillus acidophilus NCFM on systemic inflammation and gut functioning in community-dwelling elders.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in inflammatory markers but observed subtle improvements in gut functioning and stool types in the synbiotic group. The benefits were less pronounced compared to studies involving individuals with diagnosed dysbiosis.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling elders (n=49, aged not specified).
effective_dosage: Lactobacillus acidophilus NCFM at 10^9 to 10^8 UFC (colony-forming units) daily, combined with other probiotics and prebiotics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotics, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, on glycaemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: The review found that multistrain probiotics containing Lactobacillus acidophilus, administered for 6 to 12 weeks, may improve glycaemic control in adults with T2DM, based on outcomes like fasting plasma glucose and insulin resistance. Further research is needed to optimize dosing and duration.
population_specificity: Adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
effective_dosage: 7 million to 100 billion colony forming units (CFU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of probiotic (containing Lactobacillus acidophilus) and synbiotic supplementation on depression and anxiety symptoms and serum BDNF levels in HD patients.
results_summary: Synbiotic supplementation significantly reduced depression symptoms (HADS-DEP score) and improved serum BDNF levels compared to probiotic supplementation alone, particularly in patients with depressive symptoms.
population_specificity: Seventy-five hemodialysis (HD) patients.
effective_dosage: 5 g of probiotic (containing Lactobacillus acidophilus) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, on gastrointestinal symptoms and immune response markers in marathon runners.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation reduced the prevalence and severity of GI symptoms during the marathon, particularly in the latter stages, and was associated with a smaller reduction in running speed compared to placebo. However, no significant differences were found in circulatory markers between groups.
population_specificity: Recreational marathon runners
effective_dosage: 25 billion CFU (combined with other probiotic strains)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of probiotic yoghurts containing Lactobacillus acidophilus La5 and Bifidobacterium lactis Bb12 on maternal plasma glucose levels and maternal/infant complications in overweight and obese pregnant women without diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that probiotic yoghurt significantly lowered fasting plasma glucose and 2-h OGTT levels compared to conventional yoghurt, with no significant differences in gestational diabetes risk or preterm delivery. Infant bilirubin levels were also significantly lower in the probiotic group.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese pregnant women (BMI ≥ 25) with no diabetes and fasting plasma glucose < 92 mg/dl at 22 weeks of gestation.
study_duration: From 24 weeks of gestation until delivery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of synbiotic and probiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, on serum vascular dysfunction and necrosis markers in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation with synbiotics or probiotics, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, had a measurable effect on serum markers in hemodialysis patients, though specific results for Lactobacillus acidophilus alone are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients
effective_dosage: 5 g probiotic powder containing Lactobacillus acidophilus strain T16 (IBRC-M10785)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of probiotic and synbiotic supplementation, including Lactobacillus acidophilus, on serum inflammatory markers, endotoxin, and anti-HSP70 in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that synbiotic supplementation, which included Lactobacillus acidophilus, had measurable effects on serum inflammatory markers and endotoxin levels in hemodialysis patients, though specific results for Lactobacillus acidophilus alone were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients meeting specific inclusion and exclusion criteria.
effective_dosage: 5 g of probiotic powder containing Lactobacillus acidophilus T16 (among other strains), administered daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a probiotic supplement containing Lactobacillus acidophilus LA-5 on inflammation and oxidative stress biomarkers in pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM).
results_summary: The probiotic supplement significantly improved serum high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, tumor necrosis factor-α, malondialdehyde, glutathione reductase, and erythrocyte glutathione peroxidase levels compared to placebo. Interleukin-6 levels decreased in both groups but without statistical significance.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with newly-diagnosed GDM (n=64).
effective_dosage: Not specified (capsule containing four bacterial strains, including L. acidophilus LA-5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if oral intake of a Lactobacillus mixture (including L. acidophilus) could reduce recurrence rates of bacterial vaginosis in recently treated women.
results_summary: The study found that the Lactobacillus mixture significantly reduced BV recurrence (18.3% in the verum group vs. 32.1% in placebo, p = .014) and prolonged time to recurrence. Both supplements were well tolerated.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-45 with recently cured symptomatic BV, treated with metronidazole.
effective_dosage: 1 capsule (5.4 billion CFU total, with L. acidophilus comprising 20%) twice daily for 7 days, then once daily for 8-120 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether a probiotic containing Lactobacillus acidophilus LA-5 and Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis BB-12 could prevent radiation-induced diarrhea in cervical cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy.
results_summary: The probiotic significantly reduced the incidence and severity of diarrhea, decreased the need for anti-diarrheal medication, and reduced abdominal pain compared to the placebo group.
population_specificity: Cervical cancer patients receiving external beam pelvic radiotherapy with or without concurrent chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 1.75 billion lyophilized live bacteria per capsule, taken three times daily.
study_duration: From the first day of radiotherapy until the end of radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotic supplementation (including Lactobacillus acidophilus) on gut microbiota and inflammatory markers in chronic kidney disease patients undergoing hemodialysis.
results_summary: The study found that probiotic supplementation did not reduce uremic toxins or inflammatory markers in hemodialysis patients, suggesting limited efficacy in this population.
population_specificity: Chronic kidney disease patients undergoing maintenance hemodialysis (n=46, with 23 in the probiotic group).
effective_dosage: 90 billion colony-forming units per day (combined with Streptococcus thermophilus and Bifidobacterium longum).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotic supplementation (including Lactobacillus acidophilus) combined with circuit training on muscular strength, power, and cytokine responses in young males.
results_summary: The study compared probiotic supplementation with and without circuit training but did not explicitly report the specific outcomes for Lactobacillus acidophilus alone. The abstract suggests an investigation into combined effects rather than isolated probiotic efficacy.
population_specificity: Healthy sedentary young males (n=48).
effective_dosage: Multi-strain probiotics containing 3 × 10^? CFU (exact dosage incomplete in abstract).
study_duration: 12 weeks (8 weeks with 2 circuits, 9-12 weeks with 3 circuits).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if routine probiotic supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus + Lactobacillus bifidum reduces the risk of necrotising enterocolitis (NEC)≥Stage II, late-onset sepsis, and mortality in preterm neonates born at ≤32 weeks' gestation.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in NEC≥Stage II (11.3% vs. 4.8%), late-onset sepsis (16% vs. 10.5%), and mortality (19.4% vs. 2.3%) in neonates ≤32 weeks after probiotic supplementation. Benefits in neonates ≤27 weeks were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Preterm neonates born at ≤32 weeks' gestation with very low birth weight.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a probiotic formulation containing Lactobacillus acidophilus could reduce the time to reach full enteral feeds in very low birth weight newborns.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in the time to reach full enteral feeds between the probiotic and control groups, though there was a trend toward lower necrotizing enterocolitis rates in the probiotic group.
population_specificity: Very low birth weight newborns (750-1499 g) in a tertiary care NICU in Southern India.
study_duration: From initiation of enteral feeds until discharge.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of probiotic (including Lactobacillus acidophilus) and selenium co-supplementation on cognitive function and metabolic status in Alzheimer's disease patients.
results_summary: Probiotic and selenium co-supplementation significantly improved cognitive function, reduced inflammation and oxidative stress markers, and enhanced metabolic profiles compared to placebo or selenium alone.
population_specificity: 79 patients with Alzheimer's disease.
effective_dosage: Probiotic containing Lactobacillus acidophilus, Bifidobacterium bifidum, and Bifidobacterium longum (2 × 10^9 CFU/day) plus selenium (200 μg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal probiotic supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus (La-5) and other strains could reduce atopic dermatitis (AD) in offspring by modulating Th cell proportions.
results_summary: Maternal probiotic supplementation reduced Th22 cell proportions in children, which partially mediated the preventive effect on AD. Children who developed AD had higher Th22 cell proportions compared to those who did not.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and their offspring (assessed at 3 months and followed for 2 years).
effective_dosage: Combination of Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG, Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis Bb-12, and Lactobacillus acidophilus La-5 (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a probiotic mix containing Lactobacillus acidophilus, when combined with dietary intervention, was more effective than dietary intervention alone in improving body composition, lipid profile, endotoxemia, inflammation, and antioxidant activity in women with excess weight or obesity.
results_summary: The probiotic mix group showed significantly greater reductions in waist circumference, waist-height ratio, conicity index, and plasma polyunsaturated fatty acids, along with increased glutathione peroxidase activity compared to the dietary intervention alone group.
population_specificity: Women with excess weight or obesity

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal duration of a synbiotic containing Lactobacillus acidophilus for controlling respiratory infections and wheezing in young children.
results_summary: The synbiotic reduced the incidence of respiratory infections and wheezing, with significant increases in tIgA serum levels after three months and lower total IgE serum levels after nine months. The effects were most pronounced in children with recurrent respiratory infections and wheezing.
population_specificity: Children younger than five years with a history of hospitalization.
effective_dosage: 5 x 10⁹ CFU (Lactobacillus acidophilus Rosell-52, Bifidobacterium infantis Rosell-33, Bifidobacterium bifidum Rosell-71).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic supplementation with Lactobacillus acidophilus could reduce exercise-induced tryptophan degradation and the incidence of upper respiratory tract infections (URTI) in trained athletes.
results_summary: The study found that probiotic supplementation limited exercise-induced drops in tryptophan levels and reduced the incidence of URTI, though it did not improve athletic performance.
population_specificity: Thirty-three highly trained athletes during winter training.
effective_dosage: 2 × 10^10 CFU/day (Lactobacillus acidophilus CUL-60 and CUL-21, Bifidobacterium bifidum CUL-20, and Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis CUL-34).
